Description: Brotman Medical Center agreed to pay the United States $9.75 million to settle allegations that the Culver City, California facility overcharged Medicare in connection with the provision of rehabilitation services to hospital patients.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2002/June/02_civ_358.htm

Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General
Info Source: FOIA437
Notes: Source document obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request to the agency.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 424490: Other Grocery and Related Products Merchant Wholesalers
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: A Minnesota-based company has agreed to pay 15,909 employees nationwide a total of $976,765 -- $488,229 in back wages and an equal amount in liquidated damages -- after a federal investigation found the employer violated federal minimum wage requirements at its health clubs and fitness center locations in 26 states.
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: https://www.dol.gov/newsroom/releases/whd/whd20161129
https://www.eeoc.gov/eeoc/newsroom/release/1-23-17b.cfm
Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.
